LanguageData.ARA_InsectWall.label: arachne shell wall
LanguageData.ARA_InsectWall.description: It is a wall built by Arachne worker bees using a mixture of hard materials and chitin, and although it is very sturdy, it does not look very beautiful, so there is no need to build it on Arachne creep.
LanguageData.ARA_SmoothedInsectWall.label: smooth arachne carapace wall
LanguageData.ARA_SmoothedInsectWall.description: This wall was built by Arachne's worker bees by stacking a mixture of hard materials and chitin.It has been carefully polished by the Insects, making it extremely sturdy and at the same time more beautiful to look at.
LanguageData.ARA_InsectDoor.label: arachne shell door
LanguageData.ARA_InsectDoor.description: At the entrance to the Arachne burrow, the main body is made of a mixture of hard materials and chitin.The opening and closing mechanism is composed of completely unconscious Arachne insect tissue and can open and close automatically.There is no need to build on the Arachne creep.
LanguageData.Blueprint_ARA_InsectDoor.label: Arachne shell door (blueprint)
LanguageData.Frame_ARA_InsectDoor.label: Arachne shell door (construction)
LanguageData.Frame_ARA_InsectDoor.description: At the entrance to the Arachne burrow, the main body is made of a mixture of hard materials and chitin.The opening and closing mechanism is composed of completely unconscious Arachne insect tissue and can open and close automatically.There is no need to build on the Arachne creep.
LanguageData.ARA_SmoothedInsectDoor.label: smooth arachne shell door
LanguageData.ARA_SmoothedInsectDoor.description: At the entrance to the Arachne burrow, the main body is made of a mixture of hard materials and chitin.The opening and closing mechanism is composed of completely unconscious Arachne insect tissue and can be opened and closed automatically. There is no need to build on the Arachne creep.\n\nIt has already been polished by the insect swarm and now has a smooth and beautiful appearance.
LanguageData.ARA_Tumor.label: arachne fungus
LanguageData.ARA_Tumor.description: A fungus that emits a faint light and illuminates the Arachne burrow.In addition to illuminating it, it also spreads the creep over a wide area on the ground, allowing the worker bees to set up more Arachne buildings.There is no need to build on Arachne creep.
LanguageData.ARA_Tumor_SunLamp.label: Arachne light tumor
LanguageData.ARA_Tumor_SunLamp.description: It is larger than the ordinary fungus, and the internal light-emitting organs are very bright and can support the light conditions of crops.However, the lifespan is short and the creep does not spread.
LanguageData.ARA_NodeNest.label: Arachne insect burrow
LanguageData.ARA_NodeNest.description: The burrow, which the Arachne insect lives in, is a "nest" made of chitinous carapace, muscle, and connective tissue, and is an excellent recovery site for the insect.
LanguageData.ARA_ResearchBench.label: Arachne research table
LanguageData.ARA_ResearchBench.description: It is a living structure for research by the Arachne insect group, allowing the insect group to freely explore the direction of mutation and evolution.
LanguageData.ARA_SmartThermostat.label: Arachne tube type
LanguageData.ARA_SmartThermostat.description: It is an auxiliary insect that has only basic reflexes and tries to maintain the temperature of the room toward its tail by gas exchange.It must be installed on the wall like a cooler.
LanguageData.ARA_Table1x2c.label: Arachne table (1x2)
LanguageData.ARA_Table1x2c.description: It is a strange table, made of living tissue such as rocks and tentacles, and emits a faint glow due to the luminescent tissue inside its body.
LanguageData.ARA_Chair.label: bug group chair
LanguageData.ARA_Chair.description: It is a strange chair, made of living tissue such as rocks and tentacles, and emits a faint glow due to the luminescent tissue inside its body.
LanguageData.ARA_Column.label: insect swarm pillar
LanguageData.ARA_Column.description: It is a living tissue formed by the growth of tentacles within the arachne insect colony, supports the roof and prevents it from collapsing, emits light over a wide area, and is stronger than ordinary pillars.
LanguageData.ARA_Shelf.label: Insect storage shelf
LanguageData.ARA_Shelf.description: It resembles a human locker, but it actually just digs a hole in the ground and stores things there.However, thanks to its four tentacles with built-in micro-neural networks, the insects can quickly find what they need among the clutter.
LanguageData.ARA_SkillTraining_Building.label: Insect rack
LanguageData.ARA_SkillTraining_Building.description: It's a living organization for bored Arachnebugs to kill time, allowing them to practice their skills while killing time, and prevent them from interfering with the will of the hive by constantly sending idle signals.
LanguageData.ARA_Hibernate_Sac.label: Arachne dormant body
LanguageData.ARA_Hibernate_Sac.description: It is a living tissue formed when Arachne insects enter a dormant state.
